page.title: 17THE ROUND HOUSE.
page.content: The Round House is shaped like a toll house.It was the Lodge House for the Masonic Hall.The horse men rested there while the Gentlemen met at the Masonic Hall.After the building was a Lodge House it was a butchers.After being the butchers it was a tailors and is now a shop that sells material. It is a sewers paradise. Mr and Mrs Hollier who own the shop now buy their material from Trencherfields Mill in Wigan.When they buy their cloth from the mill they buy it by weight.When they sell the cloth they sell by weight.Smallish pieces cost 10 pence an ounce.As the pieces get larger they get more expensive per ounce.It is quite unusual to buy material by the ounce.You usually buy it by the yard.
